40839982.review:
Se você procura uma gameplay rápida, interessante, com uma mecânica de procurar um item para entregar para um personagem e então obter outro, e assim vai, esse é o jogo pra você.

O jogo é cheio de garotas, 10 para ser mais exato, e todas elas te prometem fotos intimas caso tu consiga um item ou um favor para elas, todas são lindas e no final todas as fotos valem a pena

A história é bem simples e não é a parte mais explorada no jogo[spoiler]  ela consiste em ter que conseguir 10 fotos de garotas para salvar uma revista falida, estilo playboy	[/spoiler]

Se tu procura um jogo para [strike] ficar excitado fácil	[/strike] se destrair por uma ou duas horas em puzzles interessantes e com garotas divertidas, você achou o jogo certo

Pros:

>10 garotas bonitas [strike] e seus corpos	[/strike] para você conhecer e explorar, cada uma com uma personalidade e um estilo diferente, porém todas com um corpo bem parecido
>Mapa pequeno, porém, com pouco aqui se faz muito, existem muitos objetivos espalhados por cada área e você vai desejar em certos momentos que o mapa seja menor, porém, vale a pena o tamanho
>Arte bonita, ao menos das prints de cada foto e do menu, e da garotas na hora de interação, o resto tu se sente em um RPG Maker só que mais caprichado
>Gameplay com potencial de repetição forte
>Sério, olha o preço dessa bagaça, eu paguei uns 6 reais e olha o quanto eu escrevi, o jogo vale a pena pelo preço barato
>5 músicas que são muito boas, porém só umas 3 da pra ouvir sem se cansar

Contras:

>Poderiam ter investido mais nas pixel arts do jogo, sério não custa nada aprender um pouco e deixar o negocio com uma cara diferente de RPG Maker
>Número pequeno de músicas, elas são boas? Sim, porém são só 5 né
>Tu passa um sentimento de frustação as vezes vendo o tanto de trabalho que vai ter que fazer pra conseguir só uma fotinho [spoiler] Na vida real é mais dificil, ou mais fácil, depende de você na real	[/spoiler]
>Só 10 garotas, e só uma foto por garota, espero que os desenvolvedores usem o dinheiro que estão ganhando para continuar pagando o artista e lançarem uma DLC com mais fotos e/ou mais garotas

É isto, comprem o jogo, é barato e ajuda o mercado ocidental de jogos de teor erótico [spoiler] Ou hentai, chamem como quiser	[/spoiler] a crescer
Vocês tem recomendação de um desenvolvedor de jogos do mesmo tipo para comprarem, é isto, boa diversão com uma ou duas mãos, você quem escolhe.

40811327.review:
This is a very cute game that focuses on some simple exploration to solve simple fetch puzzles for a variety of girls to convince them to pose for your magazine. It does contain some lewd content, even nudity but the art style is heavily stylized and has a very cute quality about it. Despite the somewhat sleazy premise, the game is actually pretty softcore and tame with it's content, the pictures you receive as a reward being the most extreme aspect.

There is a censor option for those not comfortable with the animated nudity.

This is a very short game with no real replayability, you can beat it in less than 1 hour with all achievements unlocked. The ending does hint at future sequels. I would love to see and support more of these style games, hopefully bigger with more content in the future.

It doesn't have a lot of content and it isn't very long but what is here is quite enjoyable and a fun way to kill an hour, for the very cheap price, I can recommend it!

40572086.review:
Its sad to admit I got the bananna achievment on accident. this game is pretty great, if a tad brief. You honestly feel like a normal guy, going around doing his job and not being an ass along the way. You don't get a backstory, name, or any of that jazz, but it doesn't take away from the game in the least, in fact given the brief nature of the game I think such things would have felt forced and unnessicary anyway.

-Don't like the soundtrack? Switch it for another tune you can buy at one of the shops. there are a total of... seven, I believe? Each one still feels like it fits the game, but has a different-enough feel that at least one should appeal to your tastes.

-Feeling a little prudish? Got someone around you don't want to give a bad impression? Switch on the censor mode, it only gets rid of the bits that make things "Too" revealing, so you still feel rewarded without looking like a total perv.


As far as problems with the game go, I could only count one, though perhaps it was actually an easter egg... trying to give yoga-girl an item after getting her picture will give the prompt "Do you want to quit the game? Y/N" with her sprite attached, as though she is speaking. Sure enough it'll do just that. Given that I initially tried this with a rose, some part of me hoped this would start a mini-game. It did not.

Oh, and burger-man is still depressed after you help him, instead of happily flipping burgers as a burger-man should rightly do.

If you're looking for a story intensive game, or anything that'll get the adrenaline pumping(Shooters, smart-ass), you're in the wrong place, but this game is a good cross between relaxing and being engaged at the same time. if you just go around talking to people, satisfying your own curiosity, and, well, touching things, you can pretty much solve any problem that comes your way, and make progress in the process.
I'm not a fan of giving decimals with my ratings, so I'm slapping a solid 9/10 on this game. You get exactly what you're paying for. This is no dating sim, there's no complex story to it all, or a thousand choices to make. It's not a dungeon-crawler, there are no "bad ends" here. Its a game about wandering a beach-side city in search of a few hot girls, all while listening to some killer tunes. For that I have to say it's a small gem, one that has me excited at the prospect of potential expansions, or the sequel implied by an in-game character. Fix the dialogue bug I brought up earlier and it's probably deserving of an authentic 10/10.if you liked the interactions in Undertale, and/or play visual novels, but you're not looking for anything time-consming, Fotoflash is probably right up your alley.

40355111.review:
So super short. That's not an issue but I wanna say that the game is extremely short, where I beat it under an hour unaided and got all the achivements in just over that hour. 
It's a nice little game, throws me back to playing flash games online down to a T, I would have not been suprised if this was among them back then. The old curage the cowardly dog television remote game comes to mind for me. That, and a vauge memory way back in the day of a game almost exsactly like this. Like, some porn game I probably shouldn't have been playing when I was a little girl where you get a nude photo for helping some kid play a game boy game.It's almost eerie how similar this game and that one are looking back.

The graphics are nice, sprite art look good and what little does move at least moves fluidly. You trade items for other items in hunt for the beauty shots, and the shots themselves have decent art. 
Not much I can say, you explore the town, collect stuff and trade em around untill you get all 10 shots. Simple and easy
The only thing I can mention is the control, where items aren't automaticly used or given, but you have to go into your invatory in the phone and select the item to use. 

TLDR:Not a bad way to spend an hour. Nostalgic to early flash online games of the early 2000s

40145433.review: Subject matter aside, this game offers an interesting change of pace for people who enjoy RPGs. There's no combat. Yes, it's basically just a series of fetch quests, but I do feel that the game is solid, albeit far too short. Honestly, aside from the story, the only thing I'd really change about this game is the movement, as I wish it was grid-based to account for the somewhat unpredictable collision on trees and whatnot. Highly recommended if you like point-and-click adventures and wouldn't mind having direct control over your character.

40140551.review:
[b]Foto Flash[/b] is an ecchi-style adventure game where your goal is to complete a short series of quests for ten various women around the map in order to retrieve photo shots for a pin-up magazine. The camera is sort of looking towards you at an angle from above, and the game has a kind of older, and fairly simplistic style and feel overall.  I really like that about the style, as it does have improvements over something from that older time, yet it added newer polish without spoiling the soul of that older feel...  

As you start, you'll find and grab requests from various women you encounter. For a game that reminds me of an updated older flash game, it's quite fun!  I do wish there were a little bit more art for potential research purposes.  It's nicely done artwork, but the game is quite short overall, and one can finish the entire game in around an hour or so. I played through twice though just to snag the rest of the achievements I missed the first go, so I personally enjoyed it very much.

The music was not too bad, so that's a plus.  Problem is, you have to buy new tunes at a store, and your game money is a little limited if you try to fit all the achievements into your first run through the game and have no idea what you're doing, or spending a little recklessly (on bananas, for example).


[h1]Pros[/h1]

Enjoyable gameplay, if you like small chains of tasks. I found it very addictive overall though!

Goal-oriented: You get to see anime tiddies in most pictures, and a few butt shots along with those in several, so it's nice having that motivation to press forward in your questing!  Varied poses and props in the images, and it kept things interesting as I completed a quest chain and got to snap a new "foto".

Artwork is well-done when you earn your final shots with each of the ten gals you encounter, most having that playful or humorous vibe to them.  The overall oldschool feel with more polished graphics is also nicely done.

Pretty easy to complete the game, if one likes something that is not too difficult. Aside from confusion in some spots, and wandering around with the different requests you're getting in the game, that's about the worst of the difficulty.  Pretty laid back.

Twice the pay-off!  A reward from each girl, but you also get paid in game money when you return it to the pin-up magazine business with your "foto"!

The quests were slightly varied in a few cases, so that made things a little more fun and interesting.  It worked well and helped break some possible monotony, in my opinion.


[h1]Cons[/h1]

The game is not very long. For some this might be a pro I guess.

Not enough women to take shots of!   Could use more cleavage shots, or some extra photography subjects.  A little bit more of either would have been nice.

Environment is fairly small overall.  Confusing as well at times, so a map might have been nice.

Glitched item + shop quit option. Using the catalogue on the woman in coffee shop for instance brings up a "Do you want to quit" option, for some reason.  Needs fixing as of the time of my completion of the game.

You get music you can buy as you go, but by the time I felt confident enough in having plenty of money to do all that I needed, I didn't really have a chance to listen to the tunes.  Would be better if they had been added in as rewards for finishing goals, or something similar.

It's a little above what I would consider a reasonable price for the amount of gameplay and research involved.


[h1]Conclusion[/h1]

I suggest grabbing this game sometime when it's on sale if you like shorter ecchi games.  Maybe try some of the Frank's Adventures games first if you are on the fence, since those are free, to my knowledge. 

Even though one can probably complete the entire game within the Valve policy time limit and return it, that's not cool at all!  Why would you want to do that?!  I guess if you are really that unhappy with it...  but, I think they are counting on you taking a bit longer, once you have acquired all the pictures.  Anyway, I liked it a lot!  Enough for an overall 8.5/10!

39934827.review:
Foto Flash is essentially a spiritual successor to the old series of Newgrounds flash games known as Frank's Adventure (though developed by a completely different team).  For those who get that reference I would imagine that should be enough to tell you if you'd be interested in this or not.

For those who may not get that reference, however, Foto Flash is a scavenger hunt at its core.  You play a photographer for a pin-up magazine who needs some new photos to feature in their next issue, and it's your job to go around town and find women willing to pose for pictures.  There are ten women in all to find and photograph, but each one will require you to find one or more items before they'll be willing to model for your magazine.

The visuals for the game are appealing, with some good pixel work for the characters and environments done by the developer Daner (who also did the great soundtrack as well) and some amazing artwork for the models done by an artist named Raf (her Twitter handle is @Rafchu if you wish to see more of her work).  It should be noted that most of the photos you get from the women who model for you do feature some nudity (typically some nipple slip or straight toplessness), but the developer did add in a censor mode if you wish to block that portion of the content.

At the end of the day there is very little actual gameplay here and the game is fairly short (my first run through took a little less than an hour and I got all but two of the achievements).  That being said the game is priced very fairly at $2.99.  Coupled together with the game's beautiful artwork, quirky humor, fun little scavenger hunt and catchy, upbeat soundtrack, Foto Flash makes for a light, but ultimately enjoyable experience.

39928462.review:
I never leave reviews, but this game is just too good not to.

I'll make it short and sweet. Remember going on Newgrounds when you were a youngin' and playing nothing but lewd games? Well this will help you relive this a bit. (Especially as everyone is saying, you played Frank's Adventure) 

The music is great (I'm partial to tracks B, C, and E myself) the artwork for the girls is fantastic and colorful. And although the spritework could use some work I really enjoy the style the MC has and his funky walk cycle that almost goes hand in hand with the music.

The puzzles are simple and fun, it's like one giant scavenger hunt.

Controls are a bit clunky and there's a few other bugs so maybe wait till the game has a good sale to pick it up, but I highly recommend playing. I can't wait to see what else this studio has to offer.

I'll give Foto Flash a solid 7/10, now go take pictures of some hot babes!

39922664.review:
Oh! Remember the Good Ol' Days of Franks Adventure in Newgrounds?
How we spend our days playing with one hand in the keyboard and another in the meat joystick?

Those glorious days are back. This should I say inspired "remake" is beautiful. The Artstyle from Ref is far too cute.
No 18+ nudes included due to Steam restrictions, but nippletastic nonetheless. 

The game is simple. Colect things in the map, talk to the girls, make some errands between them and collect their photos. 
The music is a non-stoping loop of funk, which suprisingly doesn't gets annoying at all. 

Kudos for the developers for this. 

In overall, it's a very nostalgic game, with a DAMN CUTE artstyle. 
(Hey Raf, do you do commisions?)

10/10 for the cheap price and fun factor for half an hour in the second playthrough to gather all acheivements. :)

To be honest? I bought the game cause the art in it looked amazing. Thought it was gonna be a simple game of doing tasks to get pics from these lovely girls. And I got more than I thought I could get. -Way- more. Not that it was a bad thing! The tasks were simple, the dialogues were great, the MUSIC was A M A Z I N G and again, the artwork for the game was top-notch.

So in conclusion: This game is definitely not for kids...BUT it's a fun, casual short game if you're an adult. Great setting and I'll look forward to another one, should there be one!

One thing I'd suggest is putting a little map to help navigate the town better (not too big an issue, I'm ok with exploring but it would still help).

Great game!

39858796.review:
In such a short game that consists mainly of a series of fetch-quests, the quality of the content is very important.  You'll explore the maze-like town in search of items to persuade various girls to pose for your magazine.  The art 'rewards' are really great.  They're stylistic but very sexy and dynamic in their own way.  The dialogue is amusing and the character names are cute.

The name of the city is a great joke too.

I had to turn off the sound because the music, although changeable via discs purchased in-game, consists of very short repeated clips that get annoying after a while.

The price is a little high considering how short it is.

You really need to enjoy the humour and art style to make this game worth playing.  Honestly I did enjoy it, but the design is somewhat clunky and shows inexperience.

39834994.review:
Although I am very slow in progressing in puzzle games such as this one, I did enjoy the games short and entertaining adventure. You continuously work with every girl you meet in the city and discover certain obstacles relating to the issue, and in the end, being rewarded with a quick peak under the cloth. 1 pic from all 10 girls!

I did have fun listening to the soundtrack while in game, and the rewards were nice to keep in the end for your eye-candy collection (if you're into the art style from the cover). For a decent price, I'd say it was fun while it lasted.

Issues to be said, a little indication of where the controls are at would make it better for newcomers, since I was forced to discover them by hand. Also, a fair warning that the use of your Mouse is not required since it is disabled while in game.
Just some side notes but it would be pretty nice if the girls did have some voices, just to make it more engaging or interesting to hear.

I don't really recommend this game to EVERYONE, some may not see this as a challenge. If you got the pocket change and free time, it's actually fun to play!

39808606.review:
全成就指南：

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1288862237
[h1]FC像素风的轻度H冒险游戏[/h1]

 [code]➽[b] 艺术风格：甜美、明亮、多彩	[/b][/code]

游戏人物与场景明显采用了红白机时代的像素风，看多了千篇一律的RPG Maker游戏，试试这种更复古的口味也蛮不错的。

立绘和CG都偏向于暖色和明亮，色彩非常饱满；线条圆润、大眼睛、略显Q版的人物形象也给人一种复古画风的日漫印象，虽然可能说不是很惊艳，但却很亲近宜人，就像龙珠一样。看了第一眼，我就放进愿望单了。在Steam上来说的话，和HunieCam Studio的画风比较类似。

[spoiler]CG基本没有太H的内容，但不是说一点都没有，而是有“两点”。截了图就不要XJB上传了，就算根本没露的CG也可能被一些傻子举报封禁。[/spoiler]

 [code]➽[b]游玩体验：轻快、动脑、环环相扣	[/b][/code]

玩家扮演一位摄影师，被杂志老板要求拍到足够的女性写真，而妹子们当然不会平白无故接受拍摄，必须完成她们交代的任务才可以。这个过程中，我没有遇到过什么bug，整个游戏的氛围也非常轻松欢快。

解谜并不难，2个小时以内就可以完成。玩过类似游戏的玩家都懂，各种捡东西、交换物品和对话触发剧情是免不了的，自己探索自己解谜是最好玩的，很多任务都要经过几个环节，经手好几个人物才可以完成，给人一种水落石出的快感。尤其是“弄拙成巧”的时刻最让人满足——比如我在做Trompette的任务时，她要求给她带来一样“虚荣的象征”，我就想当然地以为是水仙花了，毕竟水仙花的花语就是虚荣自恋嘛，结果买了花之后居然不是（怒吼：“It cost me 50 bucks!!”） 正在卡关的时候，灵机一动把水仙花送给了一个婆婆，没想到她居然高兴地收下了，还给了一个关键道具大剪刀。欸，这一下就很爽快了。

值得一提的一个缺点是，当玩家想要试错又不想承担不良后果，必然要使用SL♥♥，但是【游戏正常退出时会自动存档】，导致手动存档基本没什么意义。唯一庆幸的是，只要注意不乱花钱，是不会出现游戏进行不下去的问题的。

反过来，优点是，游戏通关之后，重新读取游戏会回到通关之前的状态，不用重头来过。

 [code]➽[b] BGM：动听、怀旧[/b][/code]

在游戏中的唱片店买了唱片之后，打开手机（菜单），可以在Music那里更换BGM。第三首的女声呻吟可以说很诱人了。整体来说，这些BGM都很动感和悦耳，有点怀旧的感觉。

[h1]总结[/h1]

如果你喜欢甜美可爱的日式画风、红白机风格的解谜冒险游戏，能够满足于轻度的视觉奖励，那么用Foto Flash来消磨一下时间也是个不错的选择。

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1288851185

39807155.review:
Bought this game. Finished it in one day. It fits its price (but given my current financial circumstances, I'd rather it be even lower). Ahem, I've "finished" the game. I haven't unlocked the super secret achievement yet, so I can't be confident in everything I write for this review.

Anyway, onto the [b]meat[/b].

If you're looking for something hardcore, like HuniePop, this game isn't for you. Sure, you get to see nip (for most of the girls at least), but that's all the stimulation you'll get out of this. It's a look-but-don't-touch policy. If you're okay with that, then this game is for you.

The puzzles aren't too hard to solve once you understand how to play the game.

As you can gather from the art, the babes are indeed gorgeous. If you want to see their lewd photos (again, they're pretty softcore), then I guess that's this game's main selling point.

Not much in the way of story and dialogue. You are but a simple man with a simple mission.

[h1]TL;DR[/h1]
[list]
    [*] Softcore solo photos (most showing nipples)
    [*] Fairly puzzling puzzles
    [*] Nice background musc
    [*] Amazingly compelling side characters (I'm looking at you, Mr. Fixit)
[/list]

[i]dividebyzero/10 - IGN[/i]

グラビア雑誌に載せる写真を集めるため、
町ゆくkawaiiガールたちのお願いを聞いて回るという…感じのアドベンチャーゲーム。
プレイ時間は1～2時間くらい。
報酬で貰える写真は乳首アリ程度のソフトな一枚絵ですがすごくグッとくる。
言語は英語のみでゲームの内容的にある程度は読めないと厳しいですが、

39798891.review:
I beat this game and got most of the achievements save for one about bananas because Im lazy.

Foto Flash is a tribute to an older series of flash games known as Frank's Adventure. The premise is simple. You are a pro photographer called in to help a magazine that somehow forgot to get any models that month.

The gameplay is very simple. The game is played from a top down view and you can talk to people nd interact with certain objects with a single button. The game boils down to walking around picking up objects and finding the right person to present them to. There are 10 girls scattered around the map each with a 'quest'. Once completed they will give you a risque image of themself to give to your boss for some cash which you can use to complete other objectives or buy different BGM. 

Thats all there really is to it, which to be fair is all its inspiration ever was. Some characters and even the location seem to be lifted straight from Frank's adventure. On the plus side though this game has entirely original art unlike Frank which just had images ripped from various H-games. The art is appealing (at least to me) although I do wish the photo's you were hunting for had actual backgrounds. The soundtrack is also funky and fun enough for the hour (or less) you play the game.

Know what you're getting into before buying I guess. Play the free Frank's adventure online and if you have fun with it then this game should be good for you. If you are looking for anything beyond a timewaster with boobs though I'd say look elsewhere. I do think $3 is just a bit much considering the amount of content here. $2 seems more fair. You should be able to beat it in one sitting.

I liked this but I do hope the developers go a little further with the next release. The Frank's Adventure series improved over time so hopefully this will as well. The ending sets up what sounds like a copy of Franks Adventure 2 but I hope the devs go a little wilder with their own creativity instead of just making 'Frank's Adventure 2 HD'. Have some more involved or crazy quests. Have some more unique girls, etc.

So again, light recommendation. There isnt anything really wrong with the game objectively.

+Art of sexy ladies
+Chilled out music
+Cheap
+Easy 100% Acheivements
~Short

39797469.review: A kooky, retro non-violent adventure game with splashes of softcore titillation of the manga kind. You play as a photographer tasked with persuading young women of Sala City to pose for you. You do this by listening to their problems, and helping to solve them, typically by finding items and delivering them to the women. While the controls are crude and the story is light, the concept is novel and well executed overall. The pixel art gameplay is nice (though wanting for more animation) and the game should keep you entertained for an hour or two. Despite its low budget, Foto Flash is crafted with character and humour. As for the unlockable pin-ups... let's just say you can expect a few surprises!

Фотографии, кстати, незацензурены изначально, патчи не нужны. Больше, кажется, и добавить нечего. Тем более что в душе все мы - извращенцы. И не спорьте.

39786564.review:
Quite simply the most exquisite analysis of the human condition that has ever been conceived.

In a world of self-driving cars, you play the only pedestrian to actually walk around the city. Your character's name: unknown. Your familial ties: unspoken. Your mission: clear.

At its core, this game takes the fundamental question of 'Where can I find a clown who's selling bananas?' and forces you to find your own answers. You make your way through the city, solving the problems of virtually everyone you meet without respite, without a single one of them giving you the courtesy of help without first getting what they want. It is this cruel lesson which we all must learn of life and I thank the game creators for breathing it into being with such majesty. 
The plot, these characters, are not simply the result of flashing pixels. This games, it lives. It has a soul and that soul, like all of them, is a source of unbelievably joy and love, while also providing crushing lows and unbridled frustration. This game is all of us and we are lucky to see ourselves reflected in such a precious mirror. 

Weep if you do not yet know this game. Mourn if you can never again experience it anew. Rejoice that you ever had the chance to know it at all.

TLDR; 7/10 There are some boobs. Drawings are pretty good, not super sexy though.

39786293.review: This is a fun little puzzle game where you fetch items in order to get hot girls to pose for you. Really short but fun. Art and soundtrack are great (especially Song C for obvious reasons).

Hope to see more games from you in the future. 

Final Rating: 9/10 -- Short & Sweet with an amazing soundtrack, art, and programming

39774091.review:
[h1]Prelude & Review Information[/h1]
 
This review is majorly free of spoilers as the story of Foto Flash is limited to lite dialogue. As such, we won't be talking about that in-depth. If you don't enjoy the plot given on the Store Page, then this game won't be for you. If you are interested in my opinion of the "H Pictures," see the category: Art and Music.
 
Before you close the serious review for what's more or less a comedic game, let me say that it was very enjoyable and it garners my recommendation. It was a palette cleanser to me after all the games I've played in the interlude. For the better, it's very casual and the puzzles are easy enough to solve. If you're looking for something short and funny, pick this up at your nearest convenience.
 
[h1]Settings[/h1]
 
There are a decent amount of settings for the game. The only criticism for this category is the option for windowed mode. If not in fullscreen mode, you cannot specify a resolution. This is otherwise a minor gripe as there are there are other ways of exiting the application while keeping it running. Fret not ye who have others in your place of staying, you can still prevent shame.
 
[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
 
Of my playtime, there were no cases of frame drops, crashes, or any other bugs to note. However, interacting with characters proved a bit difficult at first as you need to be directly in front of most characters to be able to interact with them. Only when giving them items could you be in a tile adjacent to them in any direction. This is remedied over time by the player but hopefully will be changed in future games. The puzzles are simple enough if you pay attention to the dialogue and most of the time is spent in exploration. As such, the music plays a large role.
 
For those who have trouble with direction, you would think a map would be nice. Maybe and maybe not. A map might make it a bit too simple and it wasn't a bother to explore in the slightest. Once again, this is because of the music.
 
[h1]Art and Music[/h1]
 
The overall aesthetic is very bright and colorful. Just enough to look beautiful but not enough to look blinding. I suppose this is a decent enough place to talk about the pictures which most people will buy the game for. [b]If you're looking for material, you should know the art style makes it so the girls are portrayed in a way that I don't really know how to describe. The closest style would be something akin to Huniecam Studio. As such, I don't think this is particularly what you're looking for if that's exclusively the reason you're buying the game. Otherwise, I think it's quite nice and provides a good incentive to complete the given quests.[/b]
 
The music is also very nice. Pass by the record shop in-game and pick up all the music when you have the money. They're all a joy to listen to. Even the default track is nice so you won't find yourself bored.
 
[h1]Final Thoughts[/h1]
 
It's only $2.99 and is a good pickup for when you're bored. There are a few gripes but nothing is glaringly bad and is instead inexplicably fun. Enjoy the ride and do try to hide the fact that you own this game. Not because of its quality, just its subject matter. We are people of culture, but these words also come straight from the Store Page: "Assure your friends that you're playing it for the 'story'."
